docs.abstract: San Francisco giants defeat St Louis Cardinals, 6-4, and take a 3-1 lead in the National League Championship Series.

docs.snippet: Choate learned how to handle disappointment and the news media early in his career with the help of the veteran Mike Stanton, another left-handed reliever....

docs.abstract: Veteran reliever Randy Choate finds himself in uncomfortable spotlight after his throwing error allows Brandon Crawford to race home with winning run in San Francisco Giants' victory over St Louis Cardinals in Game 3 of National League Championship Series; Choate answers every question thrown at him after the game, never offering an excuse for his error.

headline.main: After Gaffe, Cardinals’ Randy Choate Recalls Lesson Learned Early

docs.snippet: Kansas City continued its charmed postseason by scoring two runs in the first without getting a ball out of the infield, then holding on to win the A.L. pennant — the team’s first since 1985 — in a sweep....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kansas City continued its charmed postseason by scoring two runs in the first without getting a ball out of the infield, then holding on to win the A.L. pennant — the team’s first since 1985 — in a sweep.
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals beat Baltimore Orioles, 2-1, to sweep the American League Championship Series; team will move on to World Series for first time in 29 years.

headline.seo: Kansas City Royals Sweep Baltimore Orioles to Advance to World Series
